result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Blain Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 10:47am. 
Defendant Brandon C Blain in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeremy C Evans.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.
Counsel acknowledge receipt of the revocation paperwork; neither has any corrections to make to the Revocation Summary. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 

The Court sentences Mr. Blain to:
--serve eight months in Jefferson County Jail, without any work-release or Huber privileges, forthwith 
--100 days credit for time already served given
--any unpaid costs, fees, and assessments are converted to civil judgments
recess 11:10am

To Produce and Transport the Defendant from Waukesha Count Jail for proceedings in Br 3, Rm 125 of the Circuit Court of Jefferson County on September 29, 2016 at 10:30 AM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 1:18 pm [sf] (Case was scheduled for Sentencing Hearing on Revocation)
Defendant Brandon C Blain Jr. in court, in custody. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court inquires of the Defendant if he has contacted the State Public Defender to seek representation for todays hearing.
Defendant advises that he has not, that he has been in Waukesha County Jail.
Defendant indicates that he wishes to be represented by an attorney.
Court inquires of the State if the defendant is close to his maximum sentence.
ADA Shock advises that the defendant is not near his maximum sentence.

Court advises the defendant that he needs to contact the Jefferson County Public Defender before he leaves Jefferson County Jail.

recess: 1:29 pm
NEXT: (1) Sentencing Hearing on Revocation scheduled for 9/29/16 at 10:30 am - send notices (Court asks that a copy of this Notice of Hearing be sent to the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

To Produce and Transport the Defendant from Waukesha County Jail on September 13, 2016 for proceedings in Branch 3
Certified Copy to DA on 9-6-2016 /tn
Proposed Order to Produce
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Of the Plea held on October 20, 2015, before the Honorable David J Wambach

Case was scheduled for Sentencing hearing on revocation on todays date. Clerk inquired of prosecutor in courtroom, ADA Shock, of Mr. Blain's production from Waukesha County, ADA Shock informed the Clerk (with Court's presence in courtroom) that the DA's office was informed that Mr. Wilson was not released from Waukesha County Jail for production at Jefferson County, due to a hearing also scheduled at Waukesha Co.

At the direction of the Court, the Clerk contacted the Jefferson County Jail and obtained the same information
At the further direction of the Court, the Clerk contacted the Waukesha County Jail in efforts to contact the Sheriff to allow the Court to speak with the Sheriff. The Clerk was able to reach the jail secretary, who attempted to connect with the Sheriff and was unable to do so, the Clerk provided the secretary a call back number to provide the Court with additional information.

Waukesha Co. Jail staff telephoned to the Court Bench phone approximately 5-10 minutes after the Clerk disconnected with Waukesha County. The Court had a discussion with the Waukesha Co. Jail Staff and directed that the Sheriff call the Court to discuss this matter in more detail.//MA

[JA reschedule Sentencing Hearing after Revocation at Court's direction]

Case called at 8:17am [mo]
Defendant Brandon C Blain in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court strikes the Domestic Violence modifier
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 without the Domestic Violence modifier; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 as Amended, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon(real or toy)
--no acts or threats of violence
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand
--Contact with Trayvon Blain as approved by Agent 
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  4  days
The Court denies Mr. Blain expungement upon successful completion of Probation 
The Court directs the cash bond to be applied to costs.
recess: 8:44am

case called at 2:04pm. [mo]
Defendant Brandon C Blain appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that he has scheduled this case for a plea/sentencing on 10/20/15 at 8:10am

The Court requires a $150  CASH bond, with conditions:
--must be present and on time at the scheduled Branch III Plea/Sentencing hearing on 10/20/15 at 8:10am
--all other conditions as previously set
recess 2:09 pm. 


NEXT: Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 10/20/15 at 8:10am
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Mr. Blain be taken into custody he may post $500 to be released so long as the new bond indicates a new hearing date and time.

case called at 1:18pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Brandon C Blain appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Blain is eligible for PD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant


The Court requires a $750  signature bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Trayvon Blain
--no acts or threats of violence

recess 1:23  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/26/15 at 11:40am  (2) Status Conference on 10/6/15 at 9:00am
